channel.title: Compiler

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Pure_Slay Pure Slay
item.description:
@Pure_Slay wrote:

If you really have constant troubles with Compilers, just download an IDE. Almost everyone of them has a built in compiler that automatically finds your java paths and handles them accordingly.

As for not finding the JDK Path. Your path has to match:

C:\Program Files\Java\********\bin\javac.exe

As well as in your control panel -> java -> java (tab) -> environmental variables
Your JDK must be handled there as well (set name, path, ect).

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler
item.dc:creator: @Ninja111 Ninja111
item.description:
@Ninja111 wrote:

How do i make a good compler for the client? I tried 100% to make a compiler for the client and it’s not working. This is what i tried.

@echo off
title Java Compiler / Runner © Ninja
echo.------------
echo c - Compile
echo r - Run
echo.------------
set /p option=Option:
if %option%== c goto compile
if %option%== C goto compile
if %option%== r goto run
if %option%== R goto run
:compile
cls
javac java
pause
C:\Program Files\Java*******\bin\javac.exe
:run
cls
pause
exit

Somthing tells me i have the jdk in the wrong spot. Can some1 please tell me how to get the compiler working correctly? It keeps telling me i dont have jdk and all i can do is lmfao. By the way, I do have Jdk. Just dont know how to make a compiler. Thanks for the help, cough cough if i actually get some.

Read full topic
